text: Benthofascis angularis is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conorbidae.Bouchet, P. (2015). Benthofascis angularis Tucker, Tenorio & Stahlschmidt, 2011. In: MolluscaBase (2015). Accessed through: World Register of Marine Species at http://www.marinespecies.org/aphia.php?p=taxdetails&id;=565515 on 2016-07-19 These snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all. ==Description== The length of an adult shell attains 27 mm, its diameter 11.1 mm. ==Distribution== This marine species is endemic to Australia and occurs off Southwestern Australia. == Habitat == Maximum recorded depth is 30 m. ==References== * ==External links== * angularis Category:Gastropods of Australia
title: Benthofascis angularis
